div.l: For whiche this Miller stall bothe mele ⁊and corn
An hundrid tyme more than be forn
For there be forn he stall but curteislycurteilycurteisly
But now he was a thef outrageously
For whiche the wardeyn chidde ⁊and made fare
But there of sette the Miller nought a tare
He craked boost ⁊and swore it was nought so
Than were ther yonge scolers two
That dwelten in the halle of which I seie
Testif thei were ⁊and lusty for to pleie
And only for here myrthe ⁊and reuerie
Vp on the wardeyn bisily thei crie
To yef hem leue but a litell stoıı̄unde
To go to mylle ⁊and seen here corn grounde
And hardely thei durste leie here necke
The Miller schulde not stele hem half a pecke
Of corn ne be sleight ne bi force hem reue
And at the laste the wardeyn yaf hem leue
Iohn hight that oon ⁊and Aleyn hight that other
Of oon towne were thei born that hight strother
Fer in the North I can nought telle where
This Aleyn maketh redye all his gere
And on an hors the sak he cast a noon
Forth goth Aleyn the clerk ⁊and also Iohn
With good swerdes ⁊and with bokeler bi his side
Iohn knewe the weie hym nedid no gide
And atte Milne the sak a doun he laieth
Aleyn spak first · all haile Symoıı̄un in faieth
How fares thy faire doughter ⁊and thi wif
Alayn welcome ꝙquod Symkyn be my lif
And Iohn also how now what do ye here
Bi god ꝙquod Ion · Symond nede has no pere
Hym bihoues serue hym self that has no swayn
Or ellis he is a fooll as clerkis sayn
Our manciple I hope he will be deed
Swa werkis hym ay the wanges in his heed
And therfore is I come ⁊and eke Aleyn
To grynde our corn ⁊and cary it ham a gayn
I pray you spede vs hethen that ye may
It schall be don qduod Symkyn bi my fay
¶ What will ye don while that it is in honde
Bi god right be the hoper will I stonde
Qᵈuod Iohn ⁊and see how gates the corn gas ynne
Yet saugh I neuyr be my fadir kynne
How that the hoper wagges till ⁊and fra
Aleyn answerde Iohn wiltow swa
Than will I be by nethe be my croune
